content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
1. Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
   Purpose: Automates smelting by interlinking furnaces, inserters and storage with transport belts.  
   Consists of:  
   • Stone furnaces at positions (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0)  
   • Burner‑inserters at positions including (–14.5, –52.5), (–13.5, –52.5), (–14.5, –47.5), (–13.5, –47.5) among others  
   • Wooden chests at (–13.5, –51.5), (–11.5, –46.5), (1.5, 1.5), (2.5, 0.5) and (0.5, 2.5)  
   • Multiple BeltGroups (e.g. groups of 8, 73, 102 belts) that route materials between these entities

2. Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
   Purpose: Facilitates the extraction and routing of iron ore.  
   Consists of:  
   • A burner‐mining drill at position (–15.0, –50.0)  
   • An adjacent wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5)  
   • Transport belts in the vicinity (e.g. near (–14.5, –48.5) and (–15.5, –48.5)) that integrate the mining output

3. Steam Power Generation System  
   Purpose: Supplies power by converting water and fuel into steam energy.  
   Consists of:  
   • A boiler at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
   • Multiple steam engines placed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5)  
   • An extra steam engine that remains unplaced due to spatial congestion; overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts in the boiler zone prevent a clear buildable area

4. Automation Research Lab  
   Purpose: Conducts research on automation science packs.  
   Consists of:  
   • Lab units (with reported electrical IDs) that are in place but continue to show NO_POWER connectivity issues

5. Electrical, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
   Purpose: Provides an integrated backbone for power distribution, material transport and fluid handling.  
   Consists of:  
   • ElectricityGroups consolidating power poles at varied coordinates  
   • Interlinked BeltGroups and PipeGroups that connect production and processing entities

6. Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
   Purpose: Ensures a reliable water supply for fluid-dependent processes.  
   Consists of:  
   • An offshore pump positioned at (0.5, 30.5)  
   • Multiple PipeGroups conveying water throughout the network

────────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  - The extra steam engine persistently fails to be placed due to extreme spatial congestion in the boiler area.  
  - Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts around the boiler at (8.0, 20.5) – with obstructed clearance even near (8.5, 22.5) – prevent the creation of a proper buildable space.  
  - To resolve, manually reassess and clear the entire boiler zone and adjoining connection interfaces by removing or repositioning interfering entities; alternatively, consider relocating the extra steam engine or modifying the boiler layout to secure sufficient clearance.

• Fuel Supply and Connectivity Issues  
  - Burner‑inserters and the burner‑mining drill repeatedly report “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items.”  
  - Ensure that fuel sources are positioned immediately adjacent to these machines and that transport belt routing is unobstructed.

• Steam Engine and Fluid Connection Deficiencies  
  - Multiple steam engines indicate warnings of not being connected to the power network and lack proper fluid input.  
  - Review and reconfigure both electrical wiring and fluid pipeline connections to guarantee adequate supply.

• Laboratory Power Instability  
  - The Automation Research Lab continues to show NO_POWER errors.  
  - Inspect and adjust the surrounding electrical infrastructure (pole placements and wiring) to restore stable power.

────────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
(No custom functions defined.)
